title: A Slab-Serif Companion to Serif?
content:
Can any of you type geeks give me an example, or several examples, of a _good_ type superfamily with the primary design serif (better Old-Style) and the companion design slab-serif. I only know of two such superfamilies: Erik Spiekermann’s and Christian Schwartz’s [DB Serif / DB News](http://web.archive.org/web/20080408103957/http:/christianschwartz.com/dbnews.shtml), or Jean-François Porchez’s [Le Monde Livre](http://web.archive.org/web/20080408103957/http:/www.typofonderie.com/alphabets/view/LeMondeLivre) / [Le Monde Courrier](http://web.archive.org/web/20080408103957/http:/www.typofonderie.com/alphabets/view/LeMondeCourrier). I know there are more styles to either family, but I am primarily interested in the serif/slab-serif relationship. I suspect there should be more similar designs out there. Thank you in advance.

 [‹ Nick in the Toronto Star](http://web.archive.org/web/20080408103957/http:/www.typophile.com/node/33062 "Go to previous forum topic") [+&-=X Exhibition ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080408103957/http:/www.typophile.com/node/33101 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Maxim Zhukov

comments.content: TheAntiqua/TheSerif, altho TheAntiqua is kind of slab-ish to begin with.

[ITC Stone Serif and Stone Informal](http://web.archive.org/web/20080408103957/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=ITC%20Stone) have a relationship similar to the Le Mondes.

[FF Nexus Serif and Mix](http://web.archive.org/web/20080408103957/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=FF%20Nexus), though there isn’t really a “primary” style in the family.

[Freight Text and Micro](http://web.archive.org/web/20080408103957/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=Freight), though the later was designed to be used specifically at small sizes it will work anywhere.

- _TheAntiqua/TheSerif, altho TheAntiqua is kind of slab-ish to begin with_

Thanks for this example. It’s a relationship similar to Lucida’s (Regular/Bright) and Lucida Fax’s, or Lucida Typewriter’s.

- _FF Nexus Serif and Mix, though there isn’t really a “primary” style in the family._

Right... Neither DB Serif or Le Monde Livre are the primary ones in their respective superfamilies. I find the FF Nexus example quite relevant. Thanks a lot.
I wouldn’t call TheAntiqua the “primary” style either tho since it’s much newer. I don’t even have it yet.
